articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammad Salem
articles.description: The U.N. is due to start vaccinating some 640,000 children in the territory.
articles.title: Israeli bombardment kills dozens in Gaza as health officials prepare polio campaign

articles.author: Ali Sawafta
articles.description: Israel pushed ahead with a military operation in the city of Jenin.
articles.title: Israeli troops, Palestinian militants clash in West Bank

articles.author: Tom Balmforth
articles.description: Washington has limited use of military aid to Ukrainian soil.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy presses U.S. to greenlight deeper strikes into Russia

articles.author: Sarah Marsh
articles.description: Germans head to the polls in two eastern states on Sunday, with the far-right AfD on track to win a state election for the first time and Chancellor Olaf Scholz's coalition set to receive a drubbing just a year before federal elections.
articles.title: Far-right could win first state in two East German elections

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Five people were killed and 46 injured in a Ukrainian attack on the southwestern Russian city of Belgorod late on Friday, the local governor said, the latest in a series of strikes by Ukraine on the city in recent months.
articles.title: Russia says five killed, 46 injured in Ukraine strike on Belgorod

articles.author: Stanley Widianto
articles.description: A tunnel connects the mosque to the Our Lady of the Assumption cathedral.
articles.title: Pope to visit Jakarta's Istiqlal mosque in push for interfaith harmony

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Matthew Griffiths told investigators the crew did everything they could.
articles.title: Crew member on Mike Lynch yacht tells of being thrown into water

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Mexican judge ordered the Lower House of Congress not to discuss a controversial judicial reform scheduled to be taken up by lawmakers the first week of September, according to a legal document reviewed by Reuters on Saturday.
articles.title: Mexico judge orders congress not to discuss controversial judicial reform - legal document

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: More than 60 people were battling heavy winds and rains on Sunday searching for a Russian helicopter that went missing the day before with 22 aboard in the far eastern peninsula of Kamchatka, the emergencies ministry said.
articles.title: Wind, rain make search for missing Russian helicopter with 22 aboard difficult, officials says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The bodies of six hostages taken by Hamas on Oct. 7 have been recovered from a tunnel in the Rafah area of the Gaza Strip, the military said on Sunday.
articles.title: Israeli military confirms bodies of six hostages recovered in Gaza
